Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Dr. James Alexander Forbes, Jr., Union Theological Seminary, 3041 Broadway, New York, N.Y. 10027.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Levine.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Rev. Dr. James Alexander Forbes, Jr., Union Theological Seminary, 3041 Broadway, New York, N.Y. 10027.



On behalf of Council Member Levine, the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 11, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Maisel
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Maisel, the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile)  moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 11, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Communication from the Borough President of Manhattan – Submitting proposed modifications to the Fiscal Year 2016 Preliminary Budget, Pursuant to Section 245 of the Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting proposed modifications to the FY'16 Preliminary Budget.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Garodnick:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 181 East 78th Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 8, Application No. 20155354 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 181 East 78th St, Manhattan (20155354 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 140404 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 39-41 W. 23rd St a.k.a. 20-22 W. 24th St, within the Ladies’ Mile Historic District, Manhattan (C 140404 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 140405 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 39-41 W. 23rd St a.k.a. 20-22 W. 24th St, Manhattan (C 140405 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 150174 PQX shall be subject to Council review. This item is related to Application no. C 150175 HAX which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, 1561 Walton Ave, Bronx (C 150174 PQX and C 150175 HAX)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 150197 ZSX shall be subject to Council review. This item is related to Application no. N 150196 HAX which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, 986-996 Washington Ave a.k.a. 489-493 E. 164th St, Bronx (C 150197 ZSX and N 150196 HAX)

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of issuance and publication by the Mayor of a ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the Mayor of the proposed executive budget and budget message, the date of submission by the Borough Presidents of recommendations in response to the Mayor’s executive budget, the date of publication of a report by the director of the independent budget office analyzing the executive budget, the date by which the Council hearings pertaining to the executive budget shall conclude, the date by which if the expense budget has not been adopted, the expense budget and tax rate adopted as modified for the current fiscal year shall be deemed to have been extended for the new fiscal year until such time as a new expense budget has been adopted, the date by which if a capital budget and a capital program have not been adopted, the unutilized portion of all prior capital appropriations shall be deemed reappropriated, the date of submission by the Mayor of an estimate of the probable amount of receipts, the date by which any person or organization may submit an official alternative estimate of revenues, the date by which if the Council has not fixed the tax rates for the ensuing fiscal year, the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to complete the assessment rolls using estimated rates, and related matters, relating to the fiscal year two thousand sixteen
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mayor’s Executive Budget

Items.Title: Resolution approving an amendment to a previously approved real property tax exemption pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law for property located at (Block 246, Lot 1) Manhattan (Preconsidered L.U. No. 206).

Items.MatterName: LU 206 - Lands End I, Block 246, Lot 1; Manhattan, Community District No. 3, Council District No. 1.

Items.Title: Resolution (1) approving an additional exemption from real property taxes for the properties located at 212-226 9th Avenue (Block 747, Lot 1), 311-351 West 24th Street (Block 748, Lot 1), 250-268 9th Avenue (Block 749, Lot 1), 313 8th Avenue (Block 749, Lot 24), 270-296 9th Avenue (Block 751, Lot 1) and 305 9th Avenue (Block 752, Lot 1) in Manhattan, pursuant to Section 125(1)(a-4) of the Private Housing Finance Law, (2) approving a Seventh Amendatory Agreement to the Contract between the City of New York and Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc., and (3) authorizing the Mayor or any Deputy Mayor or the Commissioner of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development to execute the Seventh Amendatory Agreement when approved as to form by the Corporation Counsel and directing the City Clerk to attest to the same and to affix the seal of the City thereto. (Preconsidered L.U. No. 207)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 207 - Penn South, 212-226 9th Ave (Block 747, Lot 1), 311-351 West 24th St (Block 748, Lot 1), 250-268 9th Ave (Block 749, Lot 1), 313 8th Ave (Block 749, Lot 24), 270-296 9th Ave (Block 751, Lot 1) and 305 9th Ave (Block 752, Lot 1), Manhattan.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Land Use
Resolution commemorating the 50th anniversary of the signing of the New York City Landmarks Law.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Land Use
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: 
Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 50th anniversary of the signing of the NYC Landmarks Law.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an office of labor standards, and to repeal subdivision (i) of section 20-a of such charter and section 20-925 of such code, relating to the designation of an agency to enforce the Earned Sick Time Act

Items.MatterName: Relating to the designation of an agency to enforce the Earned Sick Time Act.

Items.MatterName: Drug strategy

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass, and the Governor to sign A.6075, which would amend the labor law, in relation to the prohibition of differential pay based on gender.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Prohibition of differential pay based on gender. (A.6075/S.1)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring landlords to distribute voter registration forms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring landlords to distribute voter registration forms.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of an affordable housing lottery task force.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creation of an affordable housing lottery task force.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Voting Rights Amendment Act of 2015 (H.R. 885), which restores and modernizes portions of the Voting Rights Act invalidated by the Supreme Court decision Shelby County v. Holder.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Voting Rights Amendment Act of 2015 (H.R. 885)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation extending the MTA tax to all for-hire vehicle trips.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Extending the MTA tax to all for-hire vehicle trips.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, the GROW AMERICA Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: GROW AMERICA Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City University of New York to include in its FY16 budget and beyond, funding to provide MetroCards to all students enrolled in CUNY Colleges free of charge
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: CUNY to include in its FY16 budget and beyond, funding to provide MetroCards to all students enrolled in CUNY Colleges free of charge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notification for pesticide application in city parks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Notification for pesticide application in city parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend New York city charter, in relation to renaming the office of the criminal justice coordinator as the office of criminal justice, and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the office of criminal justice to post on the office’s website an annual report regarding bail and the criminal justice system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the office of criminal justice to post on the office’s website an annual report regarding bail and the criminal justice system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign  S.4371/A.608, legislation which would establish a new property tax classification for properties held in condominium and cooperative form.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish a new property tax classification for properties held in condominium and cooperative form. (S.4371/A.608)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to pedestrian safety reporting.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Pedestrian safety reporting.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to evictions of disabled tenants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Evictions of disabled tenants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance to promulgate a rule which would require family shelter facilities to post the list of residents’ rights and protections in a public area.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: NYS Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance to promulgate a rule which would require family shelter facilities to post the list of residents’ rights and protections in a public area.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to amend the Social Services law in order to raise the income eligibility for child care subsidies, so more children of working families have access to early childhood education services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amend the Social Services law in order to raise the income eligibility for child care subsidies, so more children of working families have access to early childhood education services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information regarding the workforce for certain construction projects
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Information regarding employees of city contractors.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile).


There were 50 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.


With the Public Advocate (Ms. James) absent, the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) assumed the Chair as the Acting President Pro Tempore and Presiding Officer of these proceedings.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, April 28, 2015.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
The Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
